hint.text:
Volume of cone = \( \frac{Pi \times radius^2 \times height}{3} \)
Volume of cylinder = \(Pi \times radius^2 \times height\)

solution.text:
Directly proportional
Can be represented as \(\frac xy= k.\)
For same base radius and height, Volume of Cylinder \(\div\) Volume of Cone = 3.(k)
\( \Rightarrow \) Hence, they are directly proportional to each other.

content.text: The relation between the volume of a cylinder and the volume of a cone with same base radius and same height are ________________.
